summary: Redesign the Forge AI homepage into a high-density, conversion-focused, top-tier production feel (Stripe/Vercel/Linear) with only 3 major sections, improved performance (fewer motion observers), strong accessibility/SEO, and contextual placeholder marketplace preview data; regenerate after prior build failure.
architectural_notes: Homepage must be ~2–3 screens total; only 3 major sections: (1) Hero+Value+Primary CTAs, (2) How it works via accordion/tabs, (3) Marketplace preview + final dominant CTA.

Performance mandate: reduce motion observers 50–70%, minimize intersection observers; avoid min-h-screen/full viewport lock; keep motion only for hero entrance, capabilities reveal, final CTA emphasis.
Design system: replace py-20 md:py-28 with py-14 md:py-16; hero max-w-5xl, content max-w-4xl, marketplace max-w-6xl; hero padding py-16 md:py-20.
Accessibility: semantic landmarks (header/main/section/footer), ARIA labels for interactive components, accordion keyboard navigation, WCAG AA contrast.

SEO: single H1 in hero with primary keyword concept (Agent Marketplace / Autonomous AI Agents / Capability Marketplace / Agent Economy Platform); meaningful alt text; structured section hierarchy; no duplicate H1.

Technical safety: keep Next-compatible structure in mind but output should remain plain React/Vite compatible; use relative imports if alias config not guaranteed; avoid heavy parallax/autoplay/multiple stacked motion wrappers.
Marketplace preview should be placeholder/stub with contextual placeholder data (not real data integration yet).
known_issues: Homepage app generation/build failed during prior attempt; needs regeneration/retry.

existing_features.title: Refactor `frontend/src/pages/ForgeHomePage.tsx` to render exactly 3 major homepage sections in this order (and remove all other current homepage sections): (1) Hero + value + primary CTA (merged), (2) How Forge works (Accordion preferred), (3) Live marketplace preview + final CTA (merged).

Update the Hero section in `frontend/src/pages/ForgeHomePage.tsx` to follow the required hero rules: remove `min-h-screen`; use `py-16 md:py-20`; set hero container width to `max-w-5xl`; include Forge brand mark, a single H1 that contains an "agent marketplace / capability marketplace / autonomous AI agents" keyword concept, a one-line product definition, outcome-driven supporting copy, two primary CTAs ("Explore Agents" and "Enter Marketplace"), and secondary CTAs ("Build Agent" and "Start Building"); add a light trust/credibility signal within the hero (not as an extra large section).

Implement Section 2 as a compact "How Forge Works" accordion (mobile-first) with exactly the three required capability pillars: (1) Agent Discovery, (2) Workflow Orchestration, (3) Trust + Settlement. Apply layout rules: `max-w-4xl` and `py-14 md:py-16`. Ensure keyboard navigation and ARIA attributes are correct for the accordion triggers/content.

Implement Section 3 as a merged "Live marketplace" preview with contextual placeholder data (no backend dependency) plus a visually dominant final CTA. Apply layout rules: marketplace container `max-w-6xl` and spacing `py-14 md:py-16`. Include "live ecosystem" framing copy (production-ready autonomous capability economy tone) and a final dominant CTA with one of the required labels ("Enter Marketplace", "Start Using Forge", or "Launch Your Agent").

Apply global spacing/container rules across the homepage refactor: replace any `py-20 md:py-28` with `py-14 md:py-16` for non-hero sections; ensure hero uses `py-16 md:py-20`; use `max-w-5xl` for hero, `max-w-4xl` for the accordion content section, and `max-w-6xl` for the marketplace preview section.

Reduce homepage motion/observer cost by removing unnecessary `useSectionEntryMotion` usages and intersection-triggered animations for deleted sections; keep motion only for: hero entrance, capabilities/how-it-works reveal, and final CTA emphasis. Ensure the refactored homepage uses no more than 3 section-entry observers total and respects `prefers-reduced-motion`.

Ensure semantic structure, accessibility, and SEO safety on the refactored homepage: use `<main>` containing `<section>` elements; no duplicate H1; use meaningful headings (H2/H3) per section; add ARIA labels where needed on interactive CTAs/controls; maintain WCAG AA contrast for text and interactive elements.

Follow technical safety rule for imports in the homepage refactor: avoid non-guaranteed path aliases; use relative imports in `frontend/src/pages/ForgeHomePage.tsx` (including for shadcn accordion components) unless the project’s alias configuration is already confirmed working for Vite builds.

new_feature_requests.summary: Refactor Forge AI homepage into 3-section layout (Hero+Value+CTAs, Capabilities accordion/tabs, Marketplace preview+final CTA) with optimized spacing, reduced scroll depth, performance-optimized motion/observers, accessibility + SEO-safe heading hierarchy; Next-compatible structure kept in mind while remaining Vite-ready React; marketplace uses contextual placeholder data.
